subject: Re: [junit] Testing GUIs - mouse clicks, list selections, and other user  inputs
msgSnippet: ... GUI testing is difficult, but not entirely impossible.  Testing some things is easier than others, depending on the testability of the APIs for the
messageBody:
tumb@... wrote:

> Can someone give me some references to how JUnit can be used to test
> GUIs? All the examples I've seen test class fields, computations, etc.
>

GUI testing is difficult, but not entirely impossible. Testing some things
is easier than others, depending on the testability of the APIs for the
collaborating widgets.

For example, I don't know of a way to programmatically click the column
header of a table. I do know that buttons have a doClick() method, and maybe
there's a table header button available through the API somewhere. You may
also be able to employ a Robot to go through the motions, though I've never
tried it.

On the other hand, it's relatively easy to programmatically select an item
from a combo box and test that it notifies its listener:

public class MockItemListener implements ItemListener {
public String item;

public void itemStateChanged(ItemEvent ie) {
item = (String)ie.getItem();
}
}

JComboBox combo = new JComboBox();
// setup combo box

MockItemListener itemListener = new MockItemListener();
combo.addItemListener(itemListener);

combo.setSelectedItem("Animals");

assertEquals("Animals", itemListener.item);

Then you can go on to test that the panel next to the combo box contains the
appropriate text when a "real" item listener is registered with the combo
box. Again, it's basically testing that all the components of the MVC design
are hooked up properly and receiving notification.

I try to keep the GUI tests limited to the initialization, structure, and
hookup of widgets. It helps to keep the GUI as thin as possible, without any
application-level behavior buried within the view layer.

A few months back Bill Wake hosted a test-first design challenge. Bill wrote
the tests, we made them pass. The last part had us build a GUI for a simple
spreadsheet application. It really opened my eyes to ways to reasonably test
the interaction of GUI components. All the code and tests are available at

http://www.clarkware.com/tfchallenge/part5/

The GUI tests are captured in SheetFrameTest.java.
